intro: Mascagnia castanea, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Mascagnia castanea is also noted for its showy, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
